Overwatch 1 was better.

But also, props to Blizzard for not forcing their crusty app to open when you play their games here, that's a thing I wish other companies started doing, its such a disrespect to their customers to make it so BUYING and playing their games is a bigger hassle than if you were to play in ''alternative'' ways, just for that and that alone I'll give this a thumbs up. Eff Ubi and EA, down with their crusty launchers, if I buy it on Steam, let it launch only through Steam.

took my money for dlc and steams only response is to contact blizzard. blizzards response is to contact steam....

Just adding more fuel to these fire reviews.

If you want a more fun, enjoyable and absolutely more user-friendly game, try this:
https://store.steampowered.com/app/440/Team_Fortress_2/

But if you're looking for an extremely toxic playerbase (this comes from a former League of Legends and current CS:GO player), predatory monetization schemes, a corporation that loves to overpromise and underdeliver, repetitive, boring and unbalanced gameplay, destroying your mental health by trying to enjoy this dumpster fire, as well as a game that is the same game as it's predecessor but somehow managed to have less content than it, then OverwatchÂ® 2 is the game for you and I would recommend you play it.

Pretty much the only game that I play regularly since 2016. Still the most fun I can have in 10-20 minutes burst play time. I can just turn my brain off and go on quick play or I can try hard in comp. 

The only thing I miss from the OG Overwatch is the free unlockable cosmetics. Well it's not actually free since I paid for the game back in the day, but now a skin can cost $20 which is crrrrraaaazy. I bought some in the past when it's actually limited, like pink mercy or MVP jjonak zen, but I will never pay for skins in the future.

Game's still fun tho. Play it. Now.

My assessment is that when I chose to believe in Blizzard again with great apprehension, I downloaded this game full of memories. Again I chose to play for 60 minutes. That extremely familiar sense of rage instantly erupted from my heart. Shit-like matching mechanism, shit-like hero balance, shit-like skin selling mechanism, shit-like activity, shit-like operation team, shit-like Bobby Codick, shit-like 5v5, shit-like consumer player feelings. and a wave of bad reviews that immediately soared from 27,000 to 30,000 in three hours. And your shit-like political correctness and sexual minorities!!!!!! Now open your mouth and drool and come and tell me: Ah! We made a PVE mode that is how fun! But we're only going to play you with an insincere King's Road! The rest of the content will require you to purchase 100+ Hong Kong dollars to enjoy the VIP monster mini-game. Ask yourselves what else is in your eyes besides money? Are you still the Blizzard Productions Must Be Boutique?
  This time I won't hesitate to give you Overwatch 2 a bad review and join the thousands of people who are denouncing you damn Nazis.
  I've never complained about the quality of your game. It is your heart that is not on the game, so that Overwatch, a team that is supposed to uphold justice, is now beginning to look ugly. You're sorry for all of our player base. It's not just players who are locked in the China region. It's all over the world, all players who have chosen Overwatch, chosen Blizzard, chosen Overwatch Returns, and generously donated to it!
  You should kneel!

R.I.P

The game has many problems, but I think (most of) the dev team want the best for the game, and now that Microsoft is in charge the devs should have enough freedom to focus on enjoyability rather than profit.
